questions.question_text:
Which step must be performed before enabling a new inventory organization in SCM cloud for collection from Manage Upstream and Downstream Source System
Task?

choices.A: Add the Organization against the OPS destination system.
choices.D: Create a new source system for each organization.
choices.B: Add the Organization against the OPS source system manually.
choices.C: Refresh the Organization List against the Oracle Planning and Sourcing (OPS) source system.

discussion.content:
C. Refresh the Organization List against the Oracle Planning and Sourcing (OPS) source system.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/supply-chain-management/r13-update17d/faivc/implementing-planning-source-systems-and-profile-options.html#FAIVC134911

To enable organizations for data collections when the source system version is Oracle Fusion, perform the following steps:
1. Click the Manage Organization List button for your Oracle Fusion source system.
2. Click the Refresh Organization List button to update the organizations list
3. Select the Enable for Collections check box for the organizations from which you want to collect data.

questions.question_text: Which two activities can you perform by using Global Order Promisingâ€™s stand-alone work area? (Choose two.)

choices.A: You can split quantities against a Sales Order Line to perform what-if simulations and evaluate better ways of promising an order.
choices.D: You can simulate the Capable-to-Promise option in place of the Available-to-Promise option for quicker fulfillment.
choices.C: You can initiate back-to-back orders to expedite fulfillment of lines with a delayed schedule ship date.
choices.B: You can re-schedule order lines that are already scheduled.

discussion.content:
B.

Description:
Performs warehouse activities such as creating inventory transactions, processing movement requests, recording cycle and physical inventory counts, performing material put away, and confirming pick slips.


https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/supply-chain-management/20b/fammm/warehouse-operator-job-role.html#warehouse-operator-job-role

choices.A: monitor and release sales orders for picking in the warehouse
choices.E: generate pick slips for picking material for outbound material movement
choices.B: search for a pick slip and confirm it

questions.question_text: Identify the task that the seeded Warehouse Operator role can perform.

discussion.content:
Solution is correct. = B.

See https://docs.oracle.com/cloud/farel12/scmcs_gs/FAUPR/FAUPR1969475.htm#FAUPR1120614

Oracle Fusion Pricing comes predefined to apply costs from a cost list. You can also create a cost list that references a variety of charges, such as item cost, sales commission, or labor cost.

You can do the following work:

Use a cost list to implement cost plus pricing.
Use a cost list to help calculate part of the profit margin for a charge.

questions.question_text:
You are implementing Oracle Cloud Pricing for a Fortune 500 hi-tech components distributor who operates on wafer thin margins.
Identify a pricing rule associated with a pricing strategy that can be used for evaluating the margin.
Identify three ongoing maintenance tasks that a user is required to execute from the Order Management Work Area after the Order Management Implementation is completed. (Choose three.)
